title.native: 僕のヒーローアカデミア

description:
Middle school student Izuku Midoriya wants to be a hero more than anything, but he hasn’t got an ounce of power in him. With no chance of ever getting into the prestigious U.A. High School for budding heroes, his life is looking more and more like a dead end. Then an encounter with All Might, the greatest hero of them all, gives him a chance to change his destiny…

(Source: Viz Media)

Note:
- Winner of the 1st Next Manga Award in the Print Category in 2015.
- Nominated for the 8th Manga Taisho Award in 2015.
- Nominated for the 40th Kodansha Manga Award in the Shounen Category in 2016.
- Chapter count includes a bonus chapter included in volume 10 “Tsuyu-chan no Kerokero Nikki“.
hashtag: #ヒロアカ #僕のヒーローアカデミア
synonyms: My Hero Academia - Moje hrdinská akademie
มายฮีโร่อคาเดเมีย

tags.name: Superhero
tags.description: Prominently features super-powered humans who aim to serve the greater good.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Boarding School
tags.description: Features characters attending a boarding school.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Terrorism
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a terrorist or terrorist organization.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Cultivation
tags.description: Features characters using training, often martial arts-related, and other special methods to cultivate qi (a component of traditional Chinese philosophy, described as "life force") and gain strength or immortality.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Criminal Organization
tags.description: Prominently features a group of people who commit crimes for illicit or violent purposes.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Drugs
tags.description: Prominently features the usage of drugs such as opioids, stimulants, hallucinogens etc.

tags.name: Age Regression
tags.description: Prominently features a character who was returned to a younger state.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Fugitive
tags.description: Prominently features a character evading capture by an individual or organization.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Bisexual
tags.description: Features a character who is romantically or sexually attracted to people of more than one sex or gender.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

tags.name: Yakuza
tags.description: Centered around Japanese organised crime syndicates.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Robots
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid machines.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Rescue
tags.description: Centers around operations that carry out urgent treatment of injuries, remove people from danger, or save lives. This includes series that are about search-and-rescue teams, trauma surgeons, firefighters, and more.

node.description:
Horikoshi first attracted attention in the second half of 2006 when he entered Shueisha's 72nd Tezuka Award for Newcomers with his one shot _Nukegara_ and made it to the final six, where he received an Honorable Mention. Various short stories in Shueisha's Akamaru Jump followed over the years until he published his one-shot _Oumagadoki Doubutsuen_ in issue #2/2010 of Weekly Shounen Jump.

He is a former assistant of [Yasuki Tanaka](https://anilist.co/staff/97521/Yasuki-Tanaka).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/horikoshiko)

**Hometown:** Bergen, Norway

Lisa-Marie Pettersen Leira is a Norwegian translator affiliated with Outland Forlag.

[Website](https://calebdcook.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/CDCubed)

A translator for VIZ Media, Yen Press, Udon Entertainment, Square Enix, etc.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ryuhorie530) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=15056232)

He is a former assistant of the mangaka [Kouhei Horikoshi](https://anilist.co/staff/104834/Kouhei-Horikoshi).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/dorori_k) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=208166) | [Website](http://nedaland.backdrop.jp/)

Neda is a friend and former assistant of the mangaka [Kouhei Horikoshi](https://anilist.co/staff/104834/Kouhei-Horikoshi).

[Blog](https://asiadescodificada.home.blog/)

The official translator of the Portuguese editions of My Hero Academia and Assassination Classroom (volumes 6, 8-present), published by DEVIR, Portugal. Co-author of the "Mens Sana" collection of short stories (Livros de Ontem).

Graduated from Sojo University Kumamoto faculty of arts.
Kawaguchi is a former assistant of the mangaka [Kouhei Horikoshi](https://anilist.co/staff/104834/Kouhei-Horikoshi).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/KawaguchiTw)

Former assistant of the mangaka [Eiichirou Oda](https://anilist.co/staff/96881/Eiichirou-Oda), [Kouhei Horikoshi](https://anilist.co/staff/104834/Kouhei-Horikoshi), [Kouji Ooishi](https://anilist.co/staff/112651/Kouji-Ooishi), [Yoshikazu Amami](https://anilist.co/staff/137228/Yoshikazu-Amami), and [Kazue Katou](https://anilist.co/staff/103052/Kazue-Kato).

He is the son of the animator and animation director [Hiroki Shibata](https://anilist.co/staff/124452/Hiroki-Shibata). His younger sister [Hikari Shibata](https://anilist.co/staff/127324/Hikari-Shibata) is also a mangaka. He is married to the illustrator [OKADA](https://twitter.com/hoooojicha).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tokiwablue21)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nstime23) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/users/5914246)

Noguchi is a former assistant of the mangaka [Kouhei Horikoshi](https://anilist.co/staff/104834/Kouhei-Horikoshi).
